intro: Omalotheca supina, commonly known as the prostrate omalotheca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit with hairy, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically small, yellowish, and clustered in terminal inflorescences. Omalotheca supina is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, warm climates.
